intro: Lophiaris carthagenensis, commonly known as the Cape Town dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which aid in its propagation across its native range. Lophiaris carthagenensis is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
